title: Problem 2148_E
statement: Farmer John has an array a containing n positive integers and an integer k. Let a[l, r] be a subarray^{\text{∗}} of a. He performs the following procedure to independently determine if subarray a[l, r] is awesome: Initially, FJ has k empty multisets, numbered from 1 to k. Then, for each element a_i (1 ≤q i ≤q n) in a: If l≤q i≤q r (that is, a_i is in the subarray a[l, r]), he places a_i in multiset 1, Otherwise, he places a_i into any multiset he wants (which may be multiset 1). Subarray a[l, r]
